USBVSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during VLPR and VLPW modes

USBSSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during Stop, VLPS, LLS and VLLS modes.

URWE.description: USB voltage regulator enable write enable

UVSWE.description: USB voltage regulator VLP standby write enable

USSWE.description: USB voltage regulator stop standby write enable

TPM1CH0SRC.description: TPM1 channel 0 input capture source select

TPM2CH0SRC.description: TPM2 Channel 0 Input Capture Source Select

MAXADDR1.description: This field concatenated with leading zeros plus the value of the MAXADDR0 field indicates the first invalid address of the second program flash block (flash block 1)

FDCIEN.description: LCD Fault Detection Complete Interrupt Enable

CPSEL.description: Charge Pump or Resistor Bias Select

WF0.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P0 as described above for WF3.

WF1.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P1 as described above for WF3.

WF2.description: Controls segments or phases connected to LCD_P2 as described above for WF3.

WF3.description: Segment-on front plane operation - Each bit turns on or off the segments associated with LCD_P3 in the following pattern: HGFEDCBA (most significant bit controls segment H and least significant bit controls segment A)

RXEDGIE.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

RXEDGIF.description: LPUART_RX Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: LPUART_TX Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

R0T0.description: Read receive data buffer 0 or write transmit data buffer 0.

R1T1.description: Read receive data buffer 1 or write transmit data buffer 1.

R2T2.description: Read receive data buffer 2 or write transmit data buffer 2.

R3T3.description: Read receive data buffer 3 or write transmit data buffer 3.

R4T4.description: Read receive data buffer 4 or write transmit data buffer 4.

R5T5.description: Read receive data buffer 5 or write transmit data buffer 5.

R6T6.description: Read receive data buffer 6 or write transmit data buffer 6.

R7T7.description: Read receive data buffer 7 or write transmit data buffer 7.

R8T8.description: Read receive data buffer 8 or write transmit data buffer 8.

R9T9.description: Read receive data buffer 9 or write transmit data buffer 9.

PARITYE.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a parity error.

NOISY.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with noise.

SHIFTBUFBIS%s.description: Shifter Buffer N Bit Swapped Register

SHIFTBUFBYS%s.description: Shifter Buffer N Byte Swapped Register

SHIFTBUFBBS%s.description: Shifter Buffer N Bit Byte Swapped Register

HCTRIM.description: MCG High-frequency IRC Coarse Trim Register

HTTRIM.description: MCG High-frequency IRC Tempco (Temperature Coefficient) Trim Register

HFTRIM.description: MCG High-frequency IRC Fine Trim Register

LTRIMRNG.description: MCG Low-frequency IRC Trim Range Register

RANGE0.description: External Clock Source Frequency Range Select

LIRC_DIV2.description: Second Low-frequency Internal Reference Clock Divider

FLT.description: I2C Programmable Input Glitch Filter Register

SMB.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

SLTH.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

SLTL.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

SSIE.description: I2C Bus Stop or Start Interrupt Enable

IEHOST.description: This bit is set if host mode is enabled.

DPHIGH.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

USBRST.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

ERROR.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

SOFTOK.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token.

TOKDNE.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

SLEEP.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

RESUME.description: This bit is set when a K-state is observed on the DP/DM signals for 2

PIDERR.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

CRC5.description: This error interrupt has two functions

CRC16.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

DFN8.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

BTOERR.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

DMAERR.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

BTSERR.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

ODD.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

ENDP.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

ODDRST.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY.description: In Target mode, TXD_SUSPEND is set when the SIE has disabled packet transmission and reception

SE0.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

JSTATE.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

FRM.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

BDTBA.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

EPHSHK.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

EPSTALL.description: When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is called

EPTXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers. See #aal353jj

EPRXEN.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers. See #aal353jj

EPCTLDIS.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

PDE.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

SUSP.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

DMPD.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown signal output from USB.

DPPD.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown signal output from USB.

DPPU.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup signal output from USB .

DPPULLUPNONOTG.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in USB, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode.

USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.description: Combined USB Clock Recovery interrupt status

OVF_ERROR_EN.description: Determines whether OVF_ERROR condition signal is used in generation of USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.

OVF_ERROR.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the IRC48M output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the IRC48M module

CHOPEN.description: Chop oscillator enable. When set, internal chopping operation is enabled and the internal analog offset will be minimized.

SPTEF.description: SPI Transmit Buffer Empty Flag (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or SPI transmit FIFO empty flag (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

SPRF.description: SPI Read Buffer Full Flag (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or SPI read FIFO FULL flag (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

SPIE.description: SPI Interrupt Enable: for SPRF and MODF (when FIFO is not supported or not enabled) or for read FIFO (when FIFO is supported and enabled)

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

SSACKERR.description: Sticky Stop Mode Acknowledge Error Reset

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
